Trump and the 'derangement syndrome' driving people crazy
subhed: To discredit the president's opponents, the Make America Great Again movement has coined the phrase 'Trump derangement syndrome': a supposed mental illness that explains their systematic opposition. While the psychiatric argument for this has not been proven, many Democrats attest to the anger they feel every time the president speaks.

EU-Mercosur deal divides France's agricultural sectors
subhed: While the beef, poultry, beet, sugar, ethanol and cereal sectors fear increased competition from Mercosur trade bloc countries, the dairy, wine and spirits sectors stand to benefit from greater access to the Brazilian market.

title: In Ukraine, Russian forces increasingly target the railway network
subhed: Since the start of the year, the national rail company Ukrzaliznytsia has recorded more than 1,000 attacks. While most have been concentrated on stations near the Russian border and front line, the rest of the country has not been spared.

title: 'Emily in Paris,' season 5, on Netflix: Her weekend in Rome
subhed: The production moved a few episodes to Italy, where, once again, it is the character Sylvie, played by Philippine Leroy-Beaulieu, who delivers the best moments.

title: Lafarge terrorism financing trial: Defense urges court to acknowledge 'complexity' of case
subhed: The trial of the cement manufacturer on charges of terrorism financing concluded Friday, following three intense days devoted to the defense lawyers' arguments. The verdict is expected on April 13, 2026.

A French farmer's distress: 'I found the first dead cow when I went to the pasture'
subhed: Near Benque, a village an hour from Toulouse, farmer Christian Lasserre discovered three carcasses on Saturday. He fears a new outbreak of lumpy skin disease and the culling of the entire herd.

title: Trump dogged by cost of living crisis and Republican revolt
subhed: The US president tried to defuse Americans' dissatisfaction with the economy in a televised address on Wednesday. He continued to blame Joe Biden, but struggled to grasp the extent of the issue – provoking tensions within his own party.

title: 'Academic freedom at risk': The Danish university shaken by an anti-immigration cabal
subhed: Roskilde University found itself at the center of controversy over its programs, which were accused by both the far right and Social Democratic Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen of being a backdoor route to immigration for foreign students.
